info.title: URL Helper and Resolver
info.description: This class is a helper class for handling urls. It is used for resolving urls for resources and redirections.

method.name: get
method.description: Creates and returns a url with parameters in url encoding.

parameter.name: $params
parameter.description: An array of parameters as key => value.

method.name: resolve
method.description: Resolves a given URL given a subdomain and a page url in the framework.

parameter.name: $sub
parameter.description: The subdomain name. It must be a valid name.

parameter.name: $url
parameter.description: The page url. By default it's the root url ("/").

parameter.name: $protocol
parameter.description: The protocol to resolve the url to. Leave empty to decide based on the server request protocol.

method.name: resource
method.description: Resolves a resource's URL for reference to the resource's domain. The resource domain is usually the 'www'. So it is equivalent to resolve('www',...);

parameter.name: $url
parameter.description: The resource's URL to be resolved.

parameter.name: $protocol
parameter.description: The protocol to resolve the url to. The default protocol is "http".

method.name: redirect
method.description: Resolves the given url and returns a redirect url after check that the url is valid.

method.name: info
method.description: Gets the info of the url in an array.

parameter.name: $url
parameter.description: The url to get the information from. If the url is empty, get the current request url.

parameter.name: $domain
parameter.description: The url domain. This is given to distinguish the subdomains on the front. The default value is empty to get the website domain.

method.returndescription: The url info as follows: ['url'] = The full url page. ['protocol'] = The server protocol. ['sub'] = The navigation subdomain. ['domain'] = The host domain. ['params'] = An array of all url parameters by name and value. ['referer'] = The referer value, if exists.
